title: Ticket #3909: Make UPDATE_JOBAD handling more efficient in the schedd
description:
When a user runs condor_qedit to modify job ads, there are several cases where the schedd will repeatedly try to send useless UPDATE_JOBAD signals.

  • When multiple attributes are modified in the same job ad, whether in one or multiple condor_qedit commands, the UPDATE_JOBAD signal is sent multiple times.
  • When attributes in multiple jobs managed by the same gridmanager are modified, the gridmanager is signaled multiple times.
  • The schedd will repeatedly try and fail to send UPDATE_JOBAD signals for local and standard universe jobs, even though the local starter and standard shadow don't support them.
  • When resending an UPDATE_JOBAD signal, the schedd doesn't recognize when the job no longer has a shadow or gridmanager managing it, and will keep trying to send the signal periodically.
